dialogues.speaker: AN ENORMOUS BLACK EYE
dialogues.text: 1 casts its deadly stare straight at us.  Waves of heat, li ocean currents, rise up around it.  A sound like that of the fires of hell fills our ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop that....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) I'm not doing anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand is heard being slapped lightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigning pain) That hurt....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serves you right. (laughing despite herself) Will you please stop....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't help myself....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huge eye rises up toward us, then turns away and disappears, to be replaced by another just like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2 The eye belongs to a fish and the fish is frying in a pan and Ellen has just turned it.  She glances at Sean, her son, who's dressed in an Amity police uniform.  He's munching a piece of lettuce from the salad, which he's be picking at.  It's winter and she's wearing a bit of wool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're almost as fast as your father.  He could snatch a tomato out of a salad faster that a rabbit makes love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean grins at his mother and slowly tries to take more lettuce without being seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I see what you're doing....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry, Mom....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me finish dinner before you eat it...Chop the peppers....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lines up a red and green pepper and eyes them sympatha tically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry fellas....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts chopping them up and Ellen grabs her glass of w and sits herself on a stool to watch him.  Showing off a little, he starts adding some professional panache to his chopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your fingers....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cuts himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.... The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adds flavor....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sucks at his finger as she answers the phone on its second ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We don't want any....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up the phone) Hello? (smile broadens as she listens) Thea who? (laughs) I know it's Thea Brody.  How many grandchildren do I have?  I know you can use the phone by yourself. You're a big girl.  I know you're five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean, still sucking at his finger, eager to talk with his niece, moves to the phone and leans in close to the mouthpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi ya, kiddo.  How you doing down there in the sunshine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen shares the mouthpiece with her son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, Uncle Sean.  I went swimming today.  I'm taking lessons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She already swims like a fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Michael!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, bro....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sean) The fish.  Check it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You check it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on the phone....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm paying for the call....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ellen) Not if you let me have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a minute....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Thea) Your grandmother's a slave driver. Tell her to be nice to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean makes a face at his mother, who smiles at him, then continues her conversation with Thea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get the book I sent you? (listens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean studies the fish as it fries in the pan, not sure what to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask the big doctor about his work. (yelling so Michael can hear him) Tough life you Bahamian beach bum... Playing in the water all day....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heard that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to the fish.

dialogues.speaker: AMITY
dialogues.text: 4 It's the next day and the main business street of Amity is ablaze with Christmas lights and decorations.  The streets are busier than usual with traffic.  People move about with that extra sense of purpose and good cheer which accompanies the holiday season. Sean, Ellen and Tiffany, the young woman to whom Sean is engaged, are just leaving Ellen's real estate office, a storefront on the main street.  They're carrying Christma packages.  Ellen's partner, Agnes Taft, is seen at her de inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she leaves) Tomorrow we have to get the ads for the paper straightened out.  And if Mrs. Blodget calls, tell her we'll have the final offer tomorrow....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you get to leave early?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) My desk is closer to the door....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Taft grins and goes back to work as Ellen, Sean and Tiffany start across the street.  The sign above the door behind them reads:  'BRODY AND TAFT, REAL ESTATE.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing their earlier conversation) A big one....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small one...Your brother won't be here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor sees them as he moves along the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas. ELLEN                           SEAN/TIFFANY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, Jim....        Merry Christmas, Mayor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggnog time...Thursday night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor offers a large grin and hurries on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ellen) We're having a big tree and we're getting out all the old ornaments and we're going to do it right....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll put stockings on the mantel....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're putting out a sandwich and a bottle of beer for Santa....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) All right...We'll do it all...Tiffany, you have no idea what kind of mad man you're marrying....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling at Sean) Oh, yes I do....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach the front of the police station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to check in....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses his mother on the cheek and plants one on Tiffany's lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean heads for the station.  The two women watch him for moment, then move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with good humor) He has the messiest room in America....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know...but he's all mine....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen gives her a look, then smiles and the two women continue on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5 Sean moves into the front office, taking off his gloves and blowing into his hands.  The secretary, Polly, who is close to retirement, is going through a filing cabinet. There's a framed picture of Martin Brody on the wall near her.  It has a plaque beneath it which reads, MARTIN BROD POLICE CHIEF, 1973-1985.  She slams the drawer shut in he frustration at not being able to find what she's looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bad, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're out of decaf...We're out of petty cash...And we're out of requisition forms....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles sympathetically and pours himself a half cup of coffee and waits for the rest of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You have the safety talk at school, one o'clock tomorrow....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything to do before I go home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sips at his coffee, eager to be gone.  Polly opens another file and searches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That man keeps calling about his training film.  I can't convince him we don't have a S.W.A.T. team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Polly....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a final sip of coffee and puts the mug down and heads for the door.  The phone rings.  Polly moves to her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George called about the softball league.  He wants you to organize a team for next summer....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He disappears as she picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Amity Police Department... (listens; then yells  at Sean) Hold it!  There's an old dock piling drifting in the channel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean reappears in the doorway looking quizzical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; on the phone) Maybe it will just keep drifting until it goes away. (to Sean) It's stuck against a channel marker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts away again, trying to ignore it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; listening; then yelling) Hold it again!  Coast Guard's busy and it has to be cleared before the fishermen come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean moves back to the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Lenny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hand over the mouthpiece) Gone to Ben Masters' place.  Cow tipping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cow tipping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claims kids come around at night and tip over his sleeping cows.  They're not giving milk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighing) I'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Deputy Brody will take care of it personally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up and eyes Sean, who's still framed in the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call my mother.  Tell her I'll be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head and disappears at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Cow tipping....

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCKS
dialogues.text: 6 A huge banner is stretched above the docks.  It reads: AMITY ANNUAL CHRISTMAS PAGEANT. The combined forces of the high school band, chorus and dramatic society are in the process of rehearsing their musical version of the birth of Christ.  Their director, Mr. Tarkanian, is jumping about, trying to organize thing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on people.  Come on.  We go on at eight o'clock tomorrow night and... (voice rising to a scream) No one's ready....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets him some attention and his kids begin taking their places -- Mary and Joseph, the Three Wisemen, the shepherds...the sheep, the camel, which is a horse with a artificial hump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You shepherds, find your places. And don't forget the sheep....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean pulls up in the police vehicle, gets out and, grinni and shaking his head at the confusion, begins to make his way through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling at Tarkanian) Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need it with this bunch....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean pushes on, moving out on the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the Frankincense?  This is supposed to be a dress rehearsal....

dialogues.speaker: THE POLICE BOAT
dialogues.text: 7 Sean gets the engine started and casts off and the small boat makes its way from the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) You're supposed to be in costume, Joseph.  Where's your robe?  Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here I am....

dialogues.speaker: THE BAY
dialogues.text: 8 The boat moves slowly toward the channel.  Sean looks back and sees the lights and activity on the dock and smiles a little, then turns his attention to the job at hand, switching on the boat's spotlight, using it to cut through the accumulating darkness.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHANNEL
dialogues.text: 9 Sean brings the boat to the channel marker, with its smal blinking red light, and kills the engine and examines the huge piece of dock piling, most of which is beneath the s face.  It's lodged against the marker, so heavy in the wa that it's not moving an inch.  Hardly more than a shadow, his face just barely illuminated by the occasional dull r light, Sean gathers the towline and begins trying to secu it to the piling, a difficult job in the cold, which requires him to lean out over the side as far as he can. The band is heard starting up on the dock, gradually col- lecting itself until it sounds like one, playing "The Fir Noel."  A few moments later, the choir begins singing it. Suddenly the water explodes up around him violently and t boat rocks in the shock of it and a dark form is seen, fo an instant, and Sean disappears from our view.  The boat' spotlight rocks crazily.  Then the turmoil of the water d and all is calm and the singing from the dock is heard clearly again. Sean, holding onto his shredded sleeve and coat, bleeding profusely, has fallen  to a corner of the stern.  He look off toward the dock and opens his mouth to call for help, but nothing comes out.  The music grows louder as the ban and chorus find their confidence. Then a tremendous surge of water explodes upward and the dark form is seen again, for an instant, and our view of Sean is lost.  When we can see again, Sean and a corner of the stern are gone. For a moment, Sean is seen holding onto the piece of dock piling with his remaining arm.  He cries out for help but it's lost in the swelling sound of the Christmas Carol coming from the dock.  Then Sean and the pole disappear beneath the surface.  He's just gone.  A few moments late the pole pops back to the surface.  In the rocking spotlight from the boat, the clear outline of the shark's jaws can be seen where it's taken a chunk of it.  In the stillness of the night, the band and chorus suddenly stop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling; his patience exhausted) Get the star higher.  Higher!  And where the hell are the Wisemen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 Ellen in shock, moves down a corridor with Lenny, Sean's boss, the Chief.  He holds her arm as they move to a back room of the station.  Polly and a handful of townspeople watch sadly from the other end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I didn't have to, I wouldn't. (hates this conversation) There's not enough...Law requires a positive identification and there's not... (can't finish)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the door open and Ellen goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: THE BACK ROOM
dialogues.text: 11 A sheet covers the table in the center of the room. There's a slight bulge beneath it.  Ellen moves to the table.  Lenny moves to get ahead of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish there was some way to make it easy....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen, still in shock, watches as Lenny pulls back the sh She goes rigid, staring at Sean's remains without express He glances at her, then puts the sheet back.  She doesn't move.  He moves to an old desk which sits in a corner and takes up a package.  Sean's service revolver, in his hols and his badge are on top of it.  He brings them to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) His things....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks dully at Lenny, then at the package, staring at the service revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I thought you'd want them....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes what he offers and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: 12 Ellen stops and uses all her strength to compose herself. Her expression is etched with controlled rage. 13 13 and        OMITTED and 14 14

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 A taxi pulls up in front and Michael Brody, in his late twenties.  Carla, his wife, mid-twenties, and Thea, their five-year-old daughter, get out.  As the driver gathers t luggage, they look sadly at the house, then start for it. Thea doesn't really understand what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 Michael and his family move into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no answer and he looks in the living room.  It's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Anybody home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polly moves into the hall, followed by Mrs. Kintner, Agne Taft, and another woman.  They all look as though they've been working in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to her and they embrace.  Polly looks at Carla a the two women exchange sad smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polly points out toward the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's been out there for hours....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's she doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polly gives him a look, as if to say, not very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just came from Tiffany's house....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor girl...The doctor's had to sedate her....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael nods and leaves.  Polly smiles at Thea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hardly recognize you, Thea.  You're so grown up....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Sean is dead, you know. (to Carla) Will he ever come back? POLLY                           CARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Thea)                           (to Thea) You want something to eat?        We'll talk about it som more later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Polly) I had a hamburger on the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do better than that.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polly offers her hand and Thea takes it and they head for the kitchen.  Polly and Carla exchanging the knowledge of difficult this all is for a child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a funny bone sandwich?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thea giggles and they disappear into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEACH
dialogues.text: 17 Ellen stands at the shoreline, looking out toward the bay her expression empty of feeling;  stoic suppression of he feelings.  Michael moves down the beach toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and, for a long moment they look at each other, then he moves to her and takes her in his arms.  They hol onto each other for a long time.  Tears begin to well up his eyes.  She looks at him, then kisses him gently, then looks back out at the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with deadly calm) It came for him.  It waited all this time and it came for him....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she doesn't hear him.  Her mind and heart are somewhe else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18 Carla is organizing the evening meal.  Michael moves into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's putting Thea to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets a can of beer from the refrigerator and pops the top, then looks at it.  She studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I bought him his first legal drink. He got so pissed that night....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me you both did....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other, sharing their grief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) He told me a lot about you two....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla catches Ellen entering from the corner of her eye. Michael follows her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Ma....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys must be starving....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen moves to the counter and starts pulling out pots an pans, as though she's lost control of herself.  Carla mov to calm her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making dinner.  You should....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen pulls herself free from Carla's hand and continues pulling out the pots.  She stops suddenly, holding one in her hand.  She lets it drop and turns to look at Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to get out of the water....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to give up that terrible job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Mom, you can't be serious....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her voice rising) You're damn right I'm serious....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just getting started....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you in the water anymore....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops suddenly, aware that Michael and Carla are staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, you're upset.  Sit down...Please....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't have anyone in my family any- where near the water.... (coming unglued) Never again...Never....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael moves to her, trying to take her in his arms, trying to comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, come on, you can't believe that voodoo.  Sharks don't commit murder. They don't pick out a person....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling away from her son) It picked Sean...It killed your father....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad died from a heart attack....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He died from fear...From having to go out there after it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts from the room unable to control herself, not wanting to unravel completely in front of Michael and Car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a last attempt to reason with her) There's never been a great white where we live.  It's warm water... They don't like it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she moves away) Your brother's dead...Your father's dead....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Carla look at each other with grave concern.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEACH
dialogues.text: 19 The sand is hard from the cold and it's empty of people. The water is calm.  The day is sunny and peaceful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was such a good-natured kid... Always going out of his way....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was doing his job....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a piece of wood.  A shitty piece of wood.  It's not fair....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Carla move into view, their backs to us, bundled against the cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was just doing his job, Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk on in silence for a moment and we see them comi toward us.  Michael is deeply troubled.  Carla is concern about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, he could make me laugh sometimes. (pauses) He was always tagging after me when we were kids.  He wanted so much to do what I was doing....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Michael starts running.  Carla watches him for a moment, then starts running after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowhere....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts running flat out and Carla runs with him, stopp finally because he's too fast and she can't keep pace.  S watches as he works every muscle in his body, trying to exhaust himself, trying to rid himself of what he feels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 Sean, a small boy, and Martin are at the table.  Martin i lost in thought, reflecting on his dilemma about the appearance of a great white shark in Amity and the refusa of the town fathers to shut down the beaches.  Sean imita his father's every move, mimicking him in every way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To everything there is a season And a time to every purpose under the heaven; A time to be born, and a time to die....

dialogues.speaker: THE CEMETERY
dialogues.text: 22 Ellen is smiling, her expression reflecting her memory of her son and her husband.  Sean is being buried.  The Mini is conducting the gravesite service.  Thea stands next to Ellen, holding her hand.  Carla is next to her.  Michael stands on the other side of his mother.  Tiffany stands n to him.  She's crying.  Hundreds of townspeople have come to pay their last respects, Polly, Lenny, Mrs. Kintner, Mrs. Taft, Tarkanian, the Mayor and several Selectmen amo them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A time to plant, and a time to pluck up that which is planted; A time to kill, and a time to heal; A time to break down, and a time to build up; A time to weep, and a time to laugh....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 23 Martin and Sean are still at the table.  Martin finally catches his son and makes a funny face at him and Sean makes one back.  Martin opens his arms and Sean comes to him and the boy kisses his father.  Ellen watches from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A time to mourn, and a time to dance; A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together.... A time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing.... A time to seek, and a time to lose; A time to keep, and a time to cast away; A time to rend, and a time to sew....

dialogues.speaker: THE CEMETERY
dialogues.text: 24 Ellen is still smiling.  Thea is looking up at her, smili to herself, trying to figure out what's amusing her grand mother.  Michael and Carla look at Ellen with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A time to keep silence, and a time to speak; A time to love and a time to hate; A time for war, and a time for peace.

dialogues.speaker: AVRIL BAY
dialogues.text: 25 The water laps gently against the shore.  A person's legs are seen walking into it.  Ellen is revealed walking slow deliberate out into the cold water of the bay.  Her expression is set with sad determination as though she's going to keep on walking, until the water swallows her up Finally she stops, and slowly raises her right hand.  It holds Sean's service revolver.  She points it toward the water in front of her and one by one, coldly, methodicall fires all six rounds into the bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 26 Ellen, Michael, Carla and Thea leave the store and move o Thea is unwrapping a lollipop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll spoil her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what grandmas are for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen, constantly surprised by her granddaughter, laughs. It pleases Michael and Carla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to come back with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen looks at him with a raised eyebrow.  Michael's concern for her is evident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Change of scenery...Spend more time with Thea....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen looks at Carla, silently asking for her response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling; taking Ellen's arm) What do I think?  I think it's a lovely idea....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Mom.  At least consider it. You should get away.  You shouldn't be alone now....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimicking Thea) Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stay in my room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Thea) I'd like that. (to Michael) I need to be away from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, surprised, pleased by how quickly his mother agreed, smiles and she returns it, the first smile she's had for anyone but Thea and the memory of her son and husband since Sean was killed.  Carla looks at Michael, her expression etched with love and concern. 27 27 thru        OMITTED thru 28 28

dialogues.speaker: THE FERRY
dialogues.text: 29 Michael with Thea in his arms, Ellen and Carla stand together near their taxi as the ferry leaves Amity and heads for the mainland, the first leg of their journey to the Bahamas.  Thea is playing a game with Ellen, pretendi to whisper a secret.  Ellen does it back and Thea giggles hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma said, buzz, buzz, buzz....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen laughs at her granddaughter's delight.  Michael and Carla grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Swing me...Swing me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Carla start swinging Thea between them.  As Thea laughs, Ellen, suddenly, without warning, moves away and starts crying, unseen by the others.  She looks back toward the island, sobbing now, finally letting it out, taking a last look at her home.  Carla, Thea and Michael are heard laughing as they continue their game.

dialogues.speaker: AVRIL BAY
dialogues.text: 30 From the surface of the water, the ferry is seen becoming smaller and smaller as it moves away.  The old dock pilin that Sean tried to dislodge from the channel marker, that cost him his life, has washed up on the beach. It's in several pieces and bears the distinct outline of the great white shark's jaws.  Several of its teeth are lodged in the wood.

dialogues.speaker: 30-B
dialogues.text: A large Eastern airline jet descends to the airport, finally touching down and braking as it brings the Brody family to the Bahamas.  The plane flashes past....

dialogues.speaker: NASSAU BAY
dialogues.text: 31 A blur of red flashes past.  A Parachutist is being pulle by a speedboat.  Several others are revealed, then a crow of swimmers, and banana boats, and sailfish.  The busy ba it's "high season," is seen from the point of view of a l flying aircraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always wanted to ride one of those....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Chicken....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 Ellen stares down at the water, carrying her mood from Amity.  Michael and Carla ride next to and just behind he and eye Ellen with concern.  Michael is dealing with his own grief, forcing himself to put on a "strong" face for his mother.  Thea looks back from the front seat.  She's riding next to Hoagie Newcombe, the pilot, a man of Ellen age who looks the "free spirit" he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ride one sometime...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking free from  her trance) It's too dangerous....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing) Like mother, like son....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother always told me, if God had intended us to ride parachutes for fun, we'd have been born with free tickets....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) I never....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hoagie) Where's the lady who brings the soda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoagie laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) They had them on the big one....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have coffee in the thermos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm too young for coffee.  Can I drive the plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thea....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes my father puts me in his lap and lets me steer the Jeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother Hoagie....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I let special people sit on my lap and steer the plane....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He helps Thea undo her seat belt and she climbs into his lap and he puts her little hands on the wheel, then puts  his over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake tells me you're going to have to fly for the rest of your life to pay off what you lost at the crap table....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good news travels fast....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws a smile back at Michael, who smiles back, just little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'll get it back next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come it bumps up and down when there's no road?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind does that. (to Ellen) Ever been to the Bahamas before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First time for everything is the best.  After that you know too much and it's never quite the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must get bored easily. MICHAEL                                   HOAGIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not from what I've heard....                Only on Tuesd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoagie likes adventure....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael glances at Carla, who's smiling at Thea, as Hoagi gives Ellen his most charming smile.  Ellen is looking fr Michael to Hoagie, not sure what to make of it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pointing to a gauge with a horizontal white line across it. HOAGIE                           CARLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It tells me if I'm flying            (to Michael) level.  Sometimes it's hard        You okay? to tell without a road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEA                        Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you make the plane go up and down?                                   CARLA HOAGIE                    Ellen; then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this....                            Michael) She'll be okay too....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla takes Michael's hand and holds it as Hoagie puts th plane into a steep dive.  Everyone holds on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Want to go for a little ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you just go off...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the captain of this majestic ship.  It goes where I take it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures to Ellen to look below and she looks out her window.

dialogues.speaker: THE AIRPORT
dialogues.text: 34 Palm trees stir in the gentle breeze.  The terminal is decorated for Christmas.  A half-dozen islanders eye the air taxi as its wheels touch down.

dialogues.speaker: VACATION HOUSE
dialogues.text: 35 We move past large, expensive houses off a narrow road. They're landscaped beautifully.  The sound of "The Christ Song" being sung by "someone" is heard.

dialogues.speaker: 35-A
dialogues.text: Ellen stares at the houses from an early model white Cadillac as it makes its way toward Michael's house.  "Th Christmas Song" is coming from its stereo speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 Carla is in back with Ellen.  Thea is between them, resti her head against her mother's arms.  Michael is in front, next to Romeo, the driver, an Islander, black.  His car h glitter stars attached to the roof.  The stereo speakers are in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ellen) No cooking while you're here...No washing dishes...No cleaning....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not on vacation....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like Grandma's cooking....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Neptune's Folly...Our boat....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen sees, from her point of view, an old, patchwork for five-foot sailboat with a long bowsprit tied to a dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it looks like my uncle's.  He taught me how to sail when I was a kid....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's Jake's actually...Our floating lab....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen looks back at her son and offers a tentative smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Beats going to the office....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and points to the small neighborhood of houses they're entering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Jake lives over there....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen looks at several small, rundown houses with Christm decorations. Romeo, who's been eyeing Ellen in his rearview mirror, picks up his "tour guide" microphone and lowers the stere player and starts singing, doing a perfect imitation of N King Cole, singing the same song.  Michael and Carla grin and Thea pulls herself forward to watch.  Ellen catches o and laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Romeo does Tony Bennet and Johnny Mathis too.  But they all sound like Nat King Cole....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo grins and keeps on singing.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL'S HOUSE
dialogues.text: 38 The Cadillac makes its way to a house like the others and stops.  A Jeep is parked in the drive.  An outbuilding, Carla's studio, is nearby.  A small dock is in front. Despite its condition, the house is charming and is situated right on the beach.  Romeo is still singing. The family piles out.  Thea heads for the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll help you with the bags, Romeo....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can take the big one....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure is good to be home....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sure is....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romeo hums as he and Michael start unloading luggage. Carla checks the backseat.  Ellen stretches and looks at the house, trying to hide her mother's concern about the her son is living.  Carla sees her and smiles and puts he arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll grow on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it.  Really....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Carla and finds herself smiling back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has its virtues.  It hasn't fallen down yet....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch me, Grandma....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen turns and sees Thea just grabbing an old automobile tire which is suspended by a rope from a beam on the dock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thea swings out over the water and Ellen runs toward her. Carla and Michael follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Thea!  Get down from there...Thea!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thea swings back to the dock and lets go of the tire, looking from  her mother to her grandmother, not sure wha she's supposed to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; as she approaches) No, no...It's too dangerous....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy lets me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding out her hand) Come on, sweetheart....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upset) But you always let me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today.  Come on, Thea....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves to her daughter to pick her up and Thea balks. Her exhaustion from the trip is too much.  She starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, why can't I...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (becoming angry) Did you hear what I said?  Come inside....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to.  I want to swing....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thea grabs the tire and Carla grabs her and Thea starts screaming through her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can swing later.  We have to unpack now....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thea struggles in Carla's arms as they start for the hous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I didn't mean.... (trying to lighten the moment) I'm being such a Grandma....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, I'll show you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael takes her arm and they start for the studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to start that....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Don't be such a Grandma...I was always climbing something....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were a monkey....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thea is heard crying as Carla takes her into the house an they move on to the studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 39 An enormous abstract metal sculpture sits center room.  I has a huge gaping crevice near its top, not unlike a mout

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they approach) All you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen finds a smile for her son as they enter the studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) How are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We haven't had a real talk, have we? We'll do that before I go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods.  She studies his concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'll be all right, Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finding his smile) Good.  So will I....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other for a moment, then his gaze shift to the piece of sculpture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) She calls it, 'Tourist On The Loose.' Local government commissioned it. For the public beach....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling from the house) We forgot to stop at the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen studies the piece of sculpture.  The studio is fill with other metal pieces and Carla's tools, which include tanks of gas and welder's gear.  Ellen doesn't quite know what to make of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling back) Make a list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need milk....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big unveiling ceremony in a couple of weeks....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need beer....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, not quite sure what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Incredible, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His grin is contagious and she smiles and they start out together. The huge abstract sculpture, with its gaping crevice of a mouth, fills our vision. 40 40 thru        OMITTED thru 43 43

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER
dialogues.text: 44 Ellen swims off the beach by Michael's house.  She is the only person in sight.

dialogues.speaker: 44-A
dialogues.text: Ellen is seen from the point of view of something watchin her, stalking her, as she swims.  We move closer until we're beneath her.  She stops swimming and treads water. We move closer and closer. Ellen sees what's coming toward her and her expression floods with terror.  She starts swimming as fast as she c The water becomes violent as she's attacked.  She struggl and the water begins to fill with blood.  Her blood.

dialogues.speaker: THEA'S ROOM
dialogues.text: 45 Ellen's eyes pop open, wide.  Her face is still filled  with fear.

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE WATER
dialogues.text: 46 From the point of view of someone, something, we move slo through the water, exploring the seascape, which is fille with exotic plants and fish and, nearby, the old wreck of a rusting freighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through a small underwater speaker; an unhappy voice) Stop farting around....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice somewhat garbled) Stop busting my hump....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try the area around the wreck....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small wet submersible comes into view, working its way slowly over the flat sea bottom.  Michael, in wet suit an scuba gear is inside.  He's spotted a group of conch and parks the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts the bubble and leans out and starts checking the conch to separate males from females.  A single conch is shooting out the appendage which it uses to move, sinking into the sea bottom and pulling itself forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you leave me alone...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tagging them...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm separating the ladies from the gentlemen....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You moved any slower, you'd grow roots...We've got a schedule...shake it, man....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The females have eggs....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll pass around cigars....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael starts putting small round electronic tags on the conch, which he secures with epoxy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're being paid to see where they go...How they propagate....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we had some decent money, I'd be able to read their temperatures... Study their motor systems....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd leave me alone, I'd be able to get my work done....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael swims free of the sub, to get free from the range of the speaker which carries Jake's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once a grunt, always a grunt.  You got no vision, Michael.  I'm getting a signal from the first one.  You tag it right?  It's buzzing.  Sounds like a hornet trying to get out of a closet....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael ignores him.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARGE
dialogues.text: 47 Jake, an Islander, black, is listening to his headset. He's agitated.  Clarence and William, the surface crew, both Islanders, watch Jake carefully.  The barge is low in the water and broad of beam and is permanently moored to this site.  A dinghy, with an outboard, is tied to the barge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through  the phone) Michael! (to Clarence) This thing working?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You rigged it...You spent all that money on an education and you come back looking like this....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling; on the phone) Michael!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence shakes his head sadly, having fun.  Jake looks at him, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE WATER
dialogues.text: 48 Michael continues to tag conch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael...I know you can hear me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks toward the sub and the sound of Jake's voic then continues his work.

dialogues.speaker: 48-A
dialogues.text: and        OMITTED and

dialogues.speaker: 48-C
dialogues.text: A flame, almost too bright to look at, welds metal to metal. Carla works on her sculpture, adding yet another appendag to its trunk.  She looks off a something, then lowers the flame of the torch and lifts her mask and studies what sh sees, her expression reflecting both a sadness and  understanding. From her point of view, Ellen is seen washing windows outside the house.  Her back is to Carla. Carla watches Ellen for a long moment, a sad smile finall working the corners of her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was afraid to ask if you did windows....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen turns and sees Carla and, for just a moment, is troubled at being caught.  Then she offers a smile and a shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't usually...Not at these rates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen, her hair tied back, her expression showing fatigue and Carla, looking more like an auto-body worker than an artist, look at each other, neither sure what to say next

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could use a half-dozen more arms ...I've only got two weeks to get this thing finished....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you and Michael ever talk about his work...?  About spending so much time working in the water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Usually it's all he talks about...You mustn't worry....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to worry...But you know what happens, you find out that scuba diving's safer than climbing into the bathtub....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't interfere... (smiles) My mother-in-law is so neat she puts paper under the cuckoo clock....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henny Youngman....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You caught me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not interfering, Ellen....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women look at each other for another moment, then Ellen goes back to work.  Carla watches her, then flips down her mask and turns the flame back up and returns to her welding.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARGE
dialogues.text: 49 The sub is being secured by Clarence and William.  Michae is peeling out of his wet suit.  Jake is studying Michael clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) I know how to tag a damn conch....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The readings suck....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's the tags that suck....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made them, man....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stuck them on, man....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't stick them on right....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you made them right, it wouldn't happen...They leak....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) A blind man could find more conch on a mountainside....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't find your ass with both hands....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You leave me high and dry...You come back looking like a zombie....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (squaring off) Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't pick on that.  Sorry.  I'm sorry about your brother....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, just stop yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake approaches, a big grin plastered on his face, and Michael backs off, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Come on, Jake....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake wraps his arms around Michael and lifts him off the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I missed you, is all.  It's dull around here working alone...Smelling all that sweet cologne....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put me down....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Clarence and William) They won't fight with me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put me down, damnit....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake puts him down and laughs and Michael grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Maybe I missed you too....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still grinning; to Clarence) Where the hell's the beer...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you'd never ask...Coming up....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goes good with conch stew...King Conch....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence opens a cooler and pulls out four bottles of bee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to William) Conch...conch...conch research isn't sexy, William.  Doesn't attract the big bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conch is very important to our economy.  It's a good thing to study ...So we'll always have them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conch is an aphrodisiac.... (as he throws them bottles of beer) Besides, no one respectable would hire you gents anyway...not with hair like that...a while ago he couldn't get into a restaurant.  Sign said, no hats...no platts...dreads, man, dreads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They screw the tops off the beer bottles and Jake holds h up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To anything but an honest job....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh and drink.

dialogues.speaker: 49-A
dialogues.text: thru        OMITTED thru 51 51

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52 The Christmas tree, a shiny green fake job, glitters with decorations.  Thea is opening the last of her presents. Michael and Carla, who's been playing Santa Claus, Jake a Louisa, a very attractive Islander, black, in her midtwen sit on the floor.  They've all got drinks, and they're al into Thea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father was six then.  Just like you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up) I'm still five....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake makes a face and Louisa smiles at Ellen, who's sitti in a chair, taking her only pleasure from the day, her fi Christmas since Martin's death, from Thea's joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was always getting into some sort of mischief....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no doubt....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing out of the ordinary....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once he locked himself in the bathroom and your grandfather had to get the ladder and climb in through the window....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad boy....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do it on purpose....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) He didn't spank you very hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thea pulls new sneakers from a box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy spanked me once. (to her parents) Oh, these are good.  Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts them down and starts unwrapping her last present a big box.  Michael takes an outrageous Hawaiian shirt fr his box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome.  I was the one who cried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was Uncle Sean ever bad?  Did you ever spank him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen reacts.  Michael covers quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharp shirt, Jake....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May your sex life be as busy as your shirt....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every tropo needs one.... (to Louisa) Don't you want to see what Santa got you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing him mischievously) I'm not sure....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marry the man and put him out of his misery....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Louisa) Listen to Carla...Marry me...I'm tall, dark and handsome...two out of three ain't bad....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't flatter yourself.... (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thea rips the paper off the box and Michael, Carla, Jake and Louisa turn their attention to her excitement.  Ellen watches them, her smile fading as Thea moves to Jake and Louisa with the box.  Ellen's thoughts turn to Sean and s glances out the window toward the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I had a baby brother, I'd be the oldest.  I could be in charge....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen leaves the room, unobserved by the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only children are my favorites. That means you, MaGee....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My tea set.  I got my tea set. (to Jake and Louisa) Thank you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone should have a tea set....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael glances over at his mother and sees that she's going and moves to a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has a teapot and cups and saucers....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a sugar bowl and creamer....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I put real tea in it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you can put real tea in it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael sees his mother staring sadly at the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I make sandwiches...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you can make sandwiches....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling as she goes) I've got it.  I've got it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's National Geographic, tell them we only do covers....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael continues to watch his mother as the phone rings twice more, then is answered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: 53 Thea is on a chair, holding the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-ho-ho....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa Claus....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Uncle Sean, I know it's you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's stunned silence at the other end.  Thea can't figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Uncle Sean...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael moves quickly into the room, his expression etche with confusion and concern.  He grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 54 Matt Hooper is standing at a window, looking out over a city.  He feels terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael...Jesus, I'm sorry.  I...Thea thought...I'm sorry about Sean...I was away...A project at the Antarctic ...I just heard....

dialogues.speaker: 54-A
dialogues.text: Michael has his arm around Thea, who is still on the chai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Thea I'm sorry....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael gives Thea a squeeze and lifts her off the chair. She looks at her father with concern, then is attracted t the noise and laughter in the other room and heads for it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I don't know what the hell to say....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to say anything, Matt ...I know how you feel....

dialogues.speaker: 54-B
dialogues.text: Matt is still staring out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still chasing fish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still tagging conch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be done pretty soon....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tricky little devils, aren't they? How's the degree doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inch by inch....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Ellen?

dialogues.speaker: THE BEACH
dialogues.text: 55 Ellen stands perfectly still, as though hearing something no one else can hear, staring with a fixed expression at the ocean.  She seems terribly sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has good days and bad...I don't know....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a tough lady....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish there was something I could do....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's had a lot to deal with...She needs time....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you talk to her?  She's got it in her head that the shark came for him.  She still blames it for my father's death....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, boy....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56 Michael is looking out through the door, toward the windo where he was watching his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss him, Matt.  I still can't believe he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell Matt he should be here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I was...Remember the Christmas I spent with you on the island?  You were still kids...Martin put on that stupid Santa Claus suit....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stuffing came out of the pillow he was wearing....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feathers all over the place....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like having snow in the house ...Jesus, I miss them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heard yelling) Tell Uncle Matt my new Teddy bear can move its arms and legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beginning to crack) Tell her my Teddy bear snores....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58 Michael is beginning to cry.  The silence builds as he an Matt deal with the memory of Sean and Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling himself together) Let me speak to Ellen....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get her.  Have a good Christmas, Matt....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, Michael....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael puts the phone down and collects himself, then leaves.  A moment later Carla moves into the kitchen and picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I'd steal a moment with my second favorite marine biologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to bring you back a penguin I couldn't find one that wanted to winter in the Bahamas....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, a little. 59 59 thru        OMITTED thru 63 63

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 64 Ellen stares out to sea, her expression unchanged.  Micha moves out of the house, working to put on a "face" for he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matt's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and heads for the house, as though Michael's no there.  As she passes, she stops and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to give up your work....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, please don't start that again....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could teach...You could....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to quit now....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all I have left...I don't want you going in the water....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his hands on her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I do is perfectly safe.  Jake and I are scientists.  One of these days we'll be PHDs...Perfectly Harmless Derelicts...We know what we're doing.  There's nothing to worry about.  It's warm water here, remember?  Great whites hate it... Wrinkles their skin...Makes them look like prunes....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles and she manages a small one in return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Come on...You can do better than that.  You've got a big one in there somewhere....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her smile grows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) A little better.  But you'll have to do better than that.  Now go talk to Matt.  He misses you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her and she offers a genuine smile, then moves into the house.  He watches her go, still concerned.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEACH
dialogues.text: 66 Thea and Ellen are at the water's edge, building a sand castle.  Up the beach, at the point, there's a speedboat near the shore.  Hoagie is wading out to it, holding out an envelope, which the man in the boat finally is able to grab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to dig it deep so the water will go all the way around...So we can swim to it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're silly....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dig the moat, Thea with her shovel.  Ellen with her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be Buckingham Palace and you'll be Princess Di and there'll be a big Parade of Horse Guards and you'll ride in a golden carriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thea giggles and Ellen smiles her pleasure at being able  to do that, even as she begins to shudder, as though her temperature has suddenly dropped thirty degrees, and she looks out over the water, feeling something which fills h with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly; with conviction; as though talking to something unseen) You're coming, aren't you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen looks around.  Thea is still digging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one.  Nothing. (starts digging) We've got to get this finished before the tide comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not nice to be evasive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen looks at her, still surprised by what her granddaug is capable of saying.  The man in the boat looks in the envelope as Hoagie starts wading back to the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) My mother says that to my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time don't keep me waiting....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting; unhappy) Yeah...yeah...yeah....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen has turned and watches as the speedboat roars off a Hoagie grab his fishing gear and starts down the beach toward her.  Thea keeps digging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; as he spots Ellen; a big smile) Hello, Ellen....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waves.  She watches as he comes closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I don't know why I fish here...Never catch anything...Must be a sign under the water...'Beware, Hoagie's here....'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the man who drives the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (correcting her) Flies the plane....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mostly it feels like driving.  You digging for buried treasure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're building a sand castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoagie sets his gear down and squats to take a closer loo He eyes Thea playfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the architect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the artist.  Like my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoagie grins at her, then eyes Ellen, who's looking out over the water again, her expression set with foreboding.

dialogues.speaker: NEPTUNE'S FOLLY
dialogues.text: 67 Conch larva are seen under a microscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know why?  That's what happens when you lead one of those Norman Rockwell sheltered lives.  That's what's wrong with you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is revealed at the microscope, studying the conch larva.  A large fish tank, with is filled with them -- they can't be seen with the naked eye -- is nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can talk...You weren't exactly a deprived kid.  Next thing you're going to start about going back to your roots and that rock reggae crap.  Cut that hair and you're nothing but a three-piece suit....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake is at the bench which holds lab equipment and tools, writing figures in a notebook.  Above him are shelves of bottled, preserved specimens.  Clarence is drumming a nat rhythm against a bulkhead.  It's slowly getting on Jake's nerves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have three months of work and approximately no money left to support it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spent it all on beer....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake gives Clarence a dirty look and turns back to Michae

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bahamian Fisheries Department isn't exactly Fort Knox....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slides the notebook to Michael, who studies the figure

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Office of Naval Research has some money....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money is money....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They put bombs on dolphins....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a guy who got money from them to study eels....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough to put a bomb on an eel....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake gives Clarence another dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael) I'm busting my ass to get my degree... I'm tired of all this paradise shit....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake moves for the cabin door, to the deck above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael follows Jake.

dialogues.speaker: 67-A
dialogues.text: Jake moves above decks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A regular tropo...Spend the rest of your life in a bathing suit, living off nickel and dime grants.  You want to be a bum all your life, be my guest.  Not me.  I'm not growing old chasing snails and dying from terminal crotch rot....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a bad life, Jake....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're afraid of the competition out there....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming topside; doing his drumbeat as he goes) Sweet breezes...Sweet women....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Clarence) You have something to say about everything....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence keeps drumming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just trying to keep you from disappearing up your own....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're nothing but a bunch of goddamn romantics.  You're never going to amount to anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake heads for the dinghy which is tied up next to the bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; as he goes) I expect to come back here some day and find you trying to teach conch to talk.  And knock off that stupid drumming....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence stops in midbeat, creating a pocket of silence f William, who's just coming down the dock carrying two six packs of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like conch....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake gives him a dirty look, leaving poor William confuse Michael shakes his head, suppressing a grin.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEACH
dialogues.text: 68 Thea works on her sand castle, shaping the building inside the moat. Ellen and Hoagie sit at the water's edge, far enough away not to be heard.  She stares out at the water.  He studie her.  She looks at him finally, trying to rationalize the conversation they've already had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why I've told you all this.  I hardly know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes talking to a stranger is easier....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I can't explain it.  It's just something I feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always listen to my feelings....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shifts her gaze back out over the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I think I'm going crazy. The nightmares....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could have been an accident....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at him) It was no accident....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying you're wrong, just that there are other possibilities....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When it killed Sean it was like a stab in the heart.  I knew with absolute certainty that it had come for him. I knew that.  I know it's coming....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's moving toward the edge, trembling now and he takes her hand and holds it between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly; matter-of- factly) What's it cost to take a ride on that plane...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water's coming in...The water's coming in....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen stands and they move together to Thea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on where you want to go....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Just like that....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns her attention to Thea, who's helping the water fill her moat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 Hoagie and Ellen are side by side in a private aircraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the midst of it) He was struck by lightning, this man, seven times.  Took his toenail, his shoe, his hat...set his hair on fire.  But it didn't kill him.  No one could explain that....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances at him, amused by his efforts to entertain he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you just take the plane like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss' day off...Take the wheel....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you can....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one does till they learn....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lets go of the wheel and the plane starts to lose altitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't take it, we'll be swimming in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hesitates, then grabs the wheel in front of her and h puts a hand on one of hers and guides the wheel back so t plane levels off.  She's gripping the wheel so tightly he knuckles are turning white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Easy does it.  Hold her gently. She'll damn near fly herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to relax, and after a few moments, he takes his hand off hers.  She tenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's just like driving a car....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do I pull off...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) You're doing fine.  I'll keep you out of trouble.  Relax....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen stares straight ahead, trying to get the feel of it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He answers with a mischievous grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm only doing this to get out of my family's hair....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One time I was flying supplies up the Amazon.  Went down in the jungle....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to tell me, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got picked up by a tribe of head- hunters....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're impossible....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took me to the chief, who took a long look at me, then took me in his hut....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane's turning....
