dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane is indeed starting to slip into a gentle bankin turn.  It's Hoagie's doing.  He's nudging his wheel slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the hut, sitting on a pole was a shrunken head.  My head.  Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances at him, then looks ahead, not sure whether sh should be nervous about the plane's behavior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It was like looking into one of those mirrors which says, objects may be closer than they appear.  Chief said, there are two of everybody in the world and since we already have one of you, the other one can go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen laughs.  Hoagie grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) How do you like flying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's wonderful....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She eases the plane into more of a turn and enjoys the sensation.  She glances at him and he nods that she's doi just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are crazy, Ellen.  No matter what anyone says....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs and turns her attention to flying.

dialogues.speaker: AN ISLAND
dialogues.text: 70 A native festival, a parade filled with masked and costum dancers and musicians and marchers, blasts its way throug the ancient, narrow streets of an early Bahamian settleme Hoagie, wearing a windbreaker, and Ellen, who's changed h clothes, thread their way through the throng, moving like Salmon upstream against the flow of the mass of humanity moving the other way.  She's fascinated by the music and noise and color of what's around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) A few more streets....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She casts a smile at him, then returns her attention to t parade.  Hoagie navigates them through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: A STREET
dialogues.text: 71 Hoagie leads Ellen up a street no wider than an alley.  T old houses seem to lean toward each other.  The street is empty because its residents are all at the festival, whos noise follows them as they move away from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few more houses....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72 Ellen watches from the street as Hoagie and Charles Townsend, an islander, black, talk quietly on the porch. She sees Hoagie take a small, bulging envelope from his pocket and give it to Charles, who looks inside, smiles, then puts it in his pocket.  The two men shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARGE
dialogues.text: 73 Michael and Clarence are sitting at the edge of it, their feet in the water.  William is flanked out near the winch reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the horn) How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop busting my hump....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's okay for you, but not for me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've struck the mother-lode.  I'm counting... spade work....

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: 74 Jake maneuvers the sub above an enormous group of conch, trying to take measure of what he's come across.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you wouldn't say that....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spade's a garden tool....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks up from his clipboard and sees staring at him, the dead black eye of a fish whose pupil looks to be abou the size of a bowling ball.  He freezes, staring back at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Trouble with you, Jake, is you have no sense of humor....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finding his voice) Holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eye disappears and Jake starts looking for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Got a big fish down here....

dialogues.speaker: THE BARGE
dialogues.text: 75 Michael stands to scan the water and the shark explodes o of the water, over the low side of the barge, passing wit a few feet of Clarence, who freezes, his mouth open with terrified surprise, and goes straight for Michael, who throws himself to the deck.  The shark misses him by inch unable to close its great jaws about him because of the width of the barge.  As quickly as it appeared, the shark is gone.

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: 76 Hoagie and Ellen fight their way across the street, throu the festival parade.  The noise is deafening. Suddenly Ellen stops.  She shudders as she did on the bea Hoagie looks back and sees her and threads his way to her bumping into several dancers as he goes.  She's staring o into the distance, seeing something beyond the reach of h vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him and manufactures a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm terrific... Come on....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs his hand and pulls him into a group of dancers, picking up their rhythm, trying desperately to get into it.  He's forced to dance with her, though every bone in his body resists the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling above the din) Give it up....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ignores him, throwing every ounce of energy she has into the dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; yelling) You can't keep doing this....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again she ignores him and he's bumped into and they lose each other for a moment.  She dances on and he has to run to catch her.  He takes her arm and stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I can't keep doing this....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The merrymakers pass around them like a river rushes past a rock.  A band passes them and they can hardly hear themselves think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) You promised me a drink....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting back) Sharks come and go, Ellen.  People don't have anything to do with it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) The kind with an umbrella in it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up... Kick it in the ass... Get on with your life....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band passes and the noise settles, momentarily, to a dull roar as more dancers move around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I know what you're going through. The nightmares will go away... (grins) I ever tell you about the time I flew the pandas from China to a Zoo?  The lady panda fell in love with me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen starts to laugh.  She can't stop herself.  The musi grows louder.  He holds out his hand and she looks at it, then takes it and they look at each other for a long mome

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) A drink with an umbrella in it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big one....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big one....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They push their way through the parade until they disappe from view. 77 77 and        OMITTED and 78 78

dialogues.speaker: THE BARGE
dialogues.text: 79 Clarence and William, still excited, and not a little frightened, glance at the water as they secure the sub. CLARENCE                           WILLIAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never saw anything that                Should have gone f big.  Never...                        Jake. (to Michael)                    (to Jake; I was right next to you.            explaining The bastard went right                    himself) past me....                        Had you right there. Why would it come up...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is still shaky, trying to get control of himself. Jake's not buying any of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's it doing in warm water anyway...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What difference does it make?  It's here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael turns from the water and looks at Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You guys are making this into some- thing that just isn't so... It's just a shark.  A great big bloody wonderful shark.  Don't say anything to anyone. The locals find out they'll panic. They'll want to kill it. (his excitement growing) We've got us a great white, Michael. We're going to do us some real research....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly; matter-of- factly) Don't say anything about this to my mother....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks back out over the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit, man, I'm sorry....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I didn't mean to run off at the mouth like that.  She's going through a lot. I know you re hurting about your brother....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael doesn't answer.  He continues to stare at the sea his expression filled with ambivalence.  Jake puts his ar around him.

dialogues.speaker: 79-A
dialogues.text: Headlights break the darkness as a car pulls up.  Ellen g out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes his hand and starts to take it back and he hol it, looking at her in a way that suggests he'd like more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Please, Hoagie....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles and lets go of her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Ellen....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car pulls away and Ellen starts for the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to bed....

dialogues.speaker: 79-B
dialogues.text: Michael stands at the window, in the dark, watching his mother.  He's seen and heard it all.  Carla is in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took her sightseeing.  You work.. .I work... She needs someone to help take her mind off things....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her, his expression troubled.  She smiles and pats the bed next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'll take your mind off things, sailor....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds a small smile and moves to her open arms. can be heard moving into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 80 Playing cards settle softly on a felt table. Blackjack hands are being dealt to five players. Louisa deals, her fast hands expertly distributing the la of the "up" cards.  She deals her own, then glances past players as they study their cards. Jake, Carla, Ellen and Michael, all dressed for a big night out,. stand in back of the players.  Jake points to his watch impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouthing the words silently) How much longer?  This is supposed to be your party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouthing back; smiling) In a few minutes....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louisa starts dealing the first "hits." Michael glances about.  He seems on edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll check the table....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael leaves, heading for another room.  Ellen watches him go, exposing her concern for his troubled mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ellen) You want to try your hand at something...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be afraid of losing....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid of winning.  I wouldn't know what to do with the money....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat chance, cowboy....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake grins as a groundswell of excitement carries across the room, which is filled with gamblers and decorations for New Year's Eve.  The joint is jumping.  They look for its source and see Hoagie at the crap table, acceptin the congratulations of those around him.  He smiles as a large pile of chips is raked in front of him, adding to the pile he already has.  Irma, an Islander, light-skinne who's dressed in a low-cut satin gown with sequins, is hanging on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Come on... I want to see....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, Ellen on one arm, Carla on the other, moves across the room as Hoagie rolls again, and wins again.

dialogues.speaker: THE CRAP TABLE
dialogues.text: 81 Hoagie sees them approaching as the pile of chips in fron of him grows.  He smiles at Ellen, as he's given the dice again.  Irma gives Ellen a look.  The excitement at the table is high.  Bets are being placed. Everyone is eyeing Hoagie, who is slightly "pissed" and has a mischievous gl in his eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple of more passes and I'll buy my own airplane.. Hell, maybe my own airline....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing the chips) You're not going to bet it all....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All or nothing.  You want to roll them for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irma doesn't know what to make of Hoagie's interest in Ellen.  Hoagie grins, closes his eyes for a moment, makin his secret incantation, then opens them, smiles once more at Ellen and rolls.  The dice skip down the table, bounce off the other end and settle.  A soft moan goes up from the people around the table.  Hoagie's grin wavers, then is restored.  Irma has just seen her big night go up in smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snake eyes....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on your point of view....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes his chips toward the center of the table, accep condolences from a few of the players, then steps away..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It was theirs anyway.  I 11 buy us all a drink....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll buy you one.  We're having a party....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louisa's birthday....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On New Year's Eve?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats Halloween....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all start for the lounge.  Louisa is seen talking to her relief dealer.  Irma takes Hoagie's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jake) When do you and Louisa get to see each other?  Between your working days and her working nights. ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) I get her at two in the morning, when she's at her best.  Besides, how many marine biologists can cut cards with one hand and fan a deck....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They thread their way through the gaming tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) She's the Albert Einstein of gambling. Quote the odds on every game in the house....

dialogues.speaker: THE LOUNGE
dialogues.text: 82 A trio plays softly.  A dozen couples dance.  The tables are full.  Hats, horns and decorations are everywhere. Ellen, Hoagie, Irma, Michael, Carla, Jake and Louisa, who's had time to make a fast change and looks terrific, wait as Shirley, their waitress, sets the last of their drinks on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the house....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake grins at her, then at the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew there was a reason I could afford this. (toasting Louisa) To the woman of my dreams.. Who grows more beautiful....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it comes....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who grows more beautiful....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes the cow ca-ca....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pressing on) More beautiful with each passing minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait a minute... I'm being serious here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jake... (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, darling. ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They raise their glasses in a chorus of "Happy Birthday," then drinking.  Louisa grins, then eyes Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go weak in the knees on me tonight....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to make an honest woman of you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to marry you until you straighten out your life and your hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irma watches it all, her gaze shifting from face to face though she's watching a tennis match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least he doesn't have a beard....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Louisa) Do you enjoy dealing blackjack?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in management....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm training to....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manage the whole damn place some day. I'm looking forward to living in the style to which I would like to become accustomed....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd have to manage a nookie parlor to do that....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoagie roars.  Ellen laughs.  Carla nearly spits out her drink.  Irma's  not sure what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew a piano player once who....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael eyes Hoagie, none too pleased that he's joined th Hoagie smiles at him and Michael smiles back steadily, a kind of challenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to marry me, you' re going to have to straighten out your life....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting into it) He looks perfectly responsible to me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake's idea of responsibility ends with dressing himself in the morning....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing) Well, I think he's cute....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman has taste....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he has a pillow over his head....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to be careful how you talk to me... I'm about to become famous...You should see.... MICHAEL                           LOUISA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost coming                No shop talk... You out of his                        promised.... chair) Jake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching himself) Sorry....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael starts to breathe again.  Hoagie stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ellen) Would you suffer through a dance with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing) You'll be sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael shifts his gaze from Jake, who he's angry at, to Hoagie and his mother, a situation that's creating fresh alarm.  They're moving to the dance floor.  Irma is abjectly unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have two right feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  I have two left....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael) Will you lighten up.  This is supposed to be a party....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My party....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's depressed because he's started to count conch when he goes to sleep....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael casts an unhappy look at Jake, then stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads for the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: THE DANCE FLOOR
dialogues.text: 83 Ellen smiles at Hoagie, caught up in the story he's start telling her.  He stops when he sees Michael heading for them.  She sees her son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as lightly as he can) Mind if I cut in?  Your date's lonely....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world would be a better place if more sons danced with their mothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoagie returns to the table and Michael and Ellen start dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally; a trace of sarcasm) You're having a good time....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael eyes Hoagie, who's joining the others, already getting caught up in their conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Stop pouting.  You look like you did when you were six and didn't get something you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I enjoy his company....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like him chasing around after you...I don't trust him....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not chasing and I'm not running. And that's ridiculous....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael clams up and she studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I've been a pain in the ass and I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm not going to bother you anymore about your work....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a pain in the ass....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you let me finish.  I've been working on this all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him, then becomes serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Your brother's death almost killed me.  I m not sure I'll ever get over it.  But I can't allow myself to keep on believing it was intentional. I'm not going to let an obsession run my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael stares at his mother uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's not easy.  None of it is.  I have to find some way to get on with my life and I'm going to try.  I finally figured that out.  I'm going to do my best....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't seem all that happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?  Good...I thought you'd break out the champagne....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pleased.  I really am.  Really....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more sharks.  I'll stay for another week, then....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just got here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Children are never satisfied.  I have my house, my friends, my job...My life, Michael.  I have to live it. Besides, I'll be back.  Now show your mother what a good dancer you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rests her head on his shoulder and they dance on.  Hi expression reveals confusion.  He's caught between her ef to get rid of an idea and his suspicion that it may be tr

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCK
dialogues.text: 84 Michael walks from the Jeep to Neptune's Folly.  It's the beginning of a new day and he hasn't slept and looks terrible.

dialogues.speaker: NEPTUNE'S FOLLY
dialogues.text: 85 He boards her, looking for Clarence and William.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is everybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael heads for the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW DECKS
dialogues.text: 86 Jake is at the bench, soldering wires into a small cylin- drical device.  Another device like it is nearby on the b along with several small speakers and an Oscilloscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Clarence and...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gave them the day off....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael moves to the bench, not sure what's going on.  He watches Jake work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?  We've got a job to finish ...Why are you making the monitor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sun slowly sets in the West, we bid a fond farewell to the family of conch....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jake speaks he presses the barbs from the monitor to Michael's chest and the sound of his heart is heard over speaker and its rhythms are seen on the oscilloscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed off) What the hell are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake puts the barbs against his chest and his heart is heard and seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're out of money, partner.. We wrap it up, write it up and turn it in... How come your heart sounds stronger than mine?  You got two of them...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't write up anything until we're done....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.. .we're done, man....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we got the grant....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I got the grant.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I signed on....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I invited you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got it together, Jake....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...we got it together....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice rising) We have at least three months' work left.  We can't write a report...We don't know enough....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a rare bird here, Michael. Great whites don't come to the Bahamas.  There's never been one down here before.  I'm not just going to let it swim away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name goes on that report.  It's a half-assed job, I don't get my doctorate.  Neither do you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shark will get it for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael takes a hard look at him, then starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I thought we were planning a long rosy future together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did I....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake goes after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Michael and they face each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Even if it's there, it won't be around forever.  It'll figure out the water's too warm and take off. We'll never get this chance again.... It's what we were trained for, for Christ's sake.  It's why you spent all that time on the books....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Michael, who's hesitating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; grinning) We'll give it a few days, then it's back to the snails.  Indulge me, Michael....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a long moment of silence as the two men stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) I don't know shit about electronics....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) You don't know shit about anything. Time you learned....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) This is the third time this month you've forgotten to take it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She appears around the corner hauling a large plastic bag of garbage, heading for the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a lot on my mind....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He appears behind her, engaged in the same task.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't take much to remember what day they come....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brain is shrinking.  There's only so much room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give me that preoccupied scientist crap.  I'm trying to get ready for....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought artists worked with their subconscious....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a dirty look as they deposit the garbage ba in their "pickup" spot.  He tries out a smile on her.  It not working today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) How come it's my responsibility?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts for her studio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay.  Now I understand.  All you had to do was explain it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ignores him and he watches her, frustrated, until she moves inside.  Then he starts after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 She grabs her welder's mask, then fires up her torch.  He enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (before he's seen) I take out the garbage, because...I'm glad we got that straightened out....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have anything straightened out.  You're uptight about something ...what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should there be anything wrong? I'm sitting around the house, enjoying my day off and you start yelling at me about garbage....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a hard, steady look which says, there's mor to it than garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; quietly) What the hell are we arguing about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...You...I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves toward her and she holds the torch toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No fair, I'm not armed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't come any closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it off....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have work....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always wanted to make love to an angry welder.  I've dreamed of nothing else since I was a small boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can't help smiling.  She turns the torch off and he moves the rest of the way to her and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (murmuring) Close the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're at the beach....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him this time.

dialogues.speaker: THE BARGE
dialogues.text: 59 Jake is secured to the davit with a line.  Michael is tyi another line around his waist.  Clarence and William are chumming the water with meat and blood.  Several large chunks of horse meat are on lines, over the side.  Jake holds a long pole to which the heart monitoring device, with its barbs, is attached.  The big boat, their floatin lab, is secured to one side of the barge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you've done this before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of times....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael tests the knot, then Jake moves to the edge of th barge and leans out as far as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's always worked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning back at him) So far..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see the fin making its way toward the barge.  Michae tenses, moving back toward the center of the barge until the line he's holding goes taut. Jake, the pole held high, watches as the shark gets close his body tensing as he gets ready. Michael is rigid, mesmerized with the approaching shark, expression filled with what he's wondering -- will it try get him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember how to pull a rope...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks at Jake blankly, then stares at the oncomin shark, which comes closer and closer, then, at the last moment rolls to its side and opens its great jaws and goe for the horse meat. Jake waits until the shark's underside is at its most exp then rams the pole into it, then pulls it back quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hot damn!  We got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is still transfixed.  Jake looks back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now would be a good time....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael remembers his job and pulls Jake back to the barg The shark, a thirty-pound piece of horse meat in its mout rolls away, disappearing beneath the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Let's see if the damn thing works....

dialogues.speaker: WATERFRONT CAFE
dialogues.text: 90 The ocean is like a blue-green lake, its placid surface reflecting the early afternoon sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to go....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen stares out at the water, her expression wistful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You don't have to do anything you don't want to....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Hoagie, who's sitting across the table from her.  He sips his coffee and studies her.  She looks past him to the others who are still eating lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Our little island seems to agree with you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have my own little island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it gets cold in winter....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at that and sips her coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I tried winter once.  Burlington, Vermont.  Flew a run to New York.  I have a bone in my foot that still hasn't thawed.  When I was a small boy....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's hard to imagine....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) I dreamed about always being warm... Stay a while....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His tone of voice causes her to look at him quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I could take some time off....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're always taking time off....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to travel....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and he returns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'll nick the boss' plane again....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) I borrow it without telling him....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't you get in trouble...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if he finds out... It's a short hop to the Caribbean.  We could take a few days....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be plenty of women who would be glad to go....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are...I'm tired of one-way conversations....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I have this overwhelming desire to kiss you, Ellen Brody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her cheeks flooding with color) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Because it wouldn't occur to you to know why.  Blushing suits you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...I....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to be sorry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole idea is preposterous....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His expression takes on the color of his feelings.  He likes this woman, a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's flustered and unsure how to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally; trying to make light of it) You sure you don't need glasses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My vision is perfect....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans across the table and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: 90-A
dialogues.text: The shark's heartbeat is heard, then seen on the scope. Jake glances at it, then at Michael, who's at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we getting out of this old bucket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What she's got.  Nine knots....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering) Shit....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns his attention back to the scope.  The heartbeat line is beginning to flatten.  Jake climbs up on the boom and scans the water.  Michael does the same from his posi at the wheel.  He looks to Jake, who's shielding his eyes against the glare, holding the mast with his other hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) How long have you known Hoagie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you known Hoagie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell does Hoagie have to do with this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as he's been here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake turns his attention back to the water.  The sound of the heartbeat is growing weaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring her to starboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning the wheel) How long has he been here...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoagie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.  One day he was just here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake checks the EKG scope.  The line is nearly flat.  The heartbeats are a whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) He's after my mother....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake laughs, looking at Michael as though he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What's so funny about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's not good enough for her?  You're right.  If she was my mother, I'd send her home right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns his attention back to the scope, then scans the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Bring her about.  We're headed in the wrong direction....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half the pilots down here fly drugs ...He's always going off....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half don't...Bring her about....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am...You must know something about him....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gambles...He likes a good time...I see him around....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear he flies a lot of private charters....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heartbeats have stopped and Jake snaps around to look at the scope.  The line is dead flat.  He's stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the gear crapped out....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you hadn't been gassing about Hoagie....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's gone....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake gives him an angry look, then starts fiddling with t gear.  Finally, in his frustration, he bangs it with his hand.  Michael seems quietly relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll look for it tomorrow....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: 90-B
dialogues.text: Carla works on her sculpture, securing a large piece of metal near the top with a wrench, tightening huge chrome nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All he did was kiss me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) It's beginning....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen is at the base of the sculpture, watching Carla, he back to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beginning of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Whatever happens next.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always thought when I grew up I'd know what to do about things like this...I don't even know if he's serious....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither of them sees Thea, who's moved into the studio an has decided not to announce herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it some time, Ellen...See what happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Part of me wanted to go off with him, the rest of me couldn't...I don't know why he wants me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's got good taste...I don't think he's spent much time with a woman like you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what he thinks...I don't know what I think...I don't even know why I'm talking about it... (laughing) It's silly...I'm getting too old for this sort of thing....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spots Thea and stops suddenly.  Carla follows her gaz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it wasn't polite to interrupt people....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time for tea, Grandma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I almost forgot....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thea moves to Ellen, offering her hand, which Ellen takes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I put everything in my room.  My Teddy bear is joining us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carla) Thanks for the consultation....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Office hours, nine to five.  Rates go up after cocktails....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women smile at each other, then Ellen leaves with Thea and Carla returns to her work.

dialogues.speaker: 90-C
dialogues.text: Michael stands at the window, looking out at the night. He's troubled.  He clasps his hands behind his back, unaware that Thea is standing behind him, her troubled expression a mirror of his, her hands behind her back, he tiny feet spread apart exactly like his.  He scratches hi cheek unconsciously and she does the same.  She checks hi facial expression and resets hers. He sighs and she sighs and he hears and looks down, surprised to see her, then noticing that she's assumed hi body posture in every way.  He makes a funny face and she makes one back and he smiles and she returns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Sean could make funny faces....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He snatches her up off the floor and hugs her, holding on her tightly. Ellen watches from the doorway, unobserved, her concern f her son etched into her expression.  He sees her and she offers a quick smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Thea) Time for bed, peanut....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael gives his daughter a kiss and puts her down and s moves to her grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'll be in to read you a story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Daddy....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, dear heart....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thea leaves and Michael takes a beer from the refrigerato and moves to the table where three empty cans are lined u neatly.  He pops the top of the new one and takes a long drink, then sits and returns to the writing of his report on their conch project.  There are several open textbooks and several notebooks in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) It's late....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to write our report....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look tired....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She studies him as he tries to write.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you and Thea....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up, making it clear that he doesn't want to talk She sees it but presses on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You and Sean used to make....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get this finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving in a few days.  I don't want to do that with you unhappy....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I m not unhappy.  Frustrated maybe... Discouraged a little.  It'll work out....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried.. We haven't had our....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to worry about....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) I'm your mother.  It's my job....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He offers a small smile, then goes back to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You looked just like your father... The first time the shark came to Amity....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a terrible thing to know some- thing no one else wants to believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) I'm tired of hearing about it. There's no shark.  Sean wasn't killed by the same shark.. Dad didn't die because of it...It's all wrong... Some fantasy you've concocted...You keep bringing it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes back to work, ignoring her.  She wants to say mor but stops herself.  Instead she starts looking through th refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally; quietly) You hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches him, her expression sad and filled with conce

dialogues.speaker: 90-D
dialogues.text: The surface is searched, as though something is being looked for.  The shark is seen, swimming, just swimming, its fin slicing through the water as though it's hearing its own music.  Then, without warning, it attacks, coming straight at us, its great jaws opening wide, rolling to o side as it comes for the kill -- its great rows of teeth enveloping us, closing down on us, consuming us, until it goes dark.

dialogues.speaker: 90-E
dialogues.text: Michael wakes with a fearful start, his eyes open wide.

dialogues.speaker: 90-F
dialogues.text: Ellen lunges upright, her expression set with terror.

dialogues.speaker: 90-G
dialogues.text: Michael trembles.  He can't stop it.

dialogues.speaker: 90-H
dialogues.text: Ellen struggles to control her breathing.  She's close to hyperventilating.

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE WATER
dialogues.text: 91 Michael searches for conch, moving slowly through the wat

dialogues.speaker: NEPTUNE'S FOLLY/THE BARGE
dialogues.text: 92 Jake watches the scope, which is dead flat.  There's no sound coming from the speaker next to it. Clarence and William, on the barge, search the surface of the water with binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: 92-A
dialogues.text: Michael continues to search for conch.  From his point of view, the water is clear, filled only with colorful fish and streaks of sunlight from above.  Then he spots a smal group of conch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got about a half dozen...I'm going to tag them.  You hearing anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.. But stay within a quarter mile...I've got a three-mile radius on the monitor.  If he comes back I'll hear him.  You'll have time to get up.

dialogues.speaker: 92-B
dialogues.text: Jake glances at Clarence and William, who continue to search visually for signs of the shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Looks like....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the shark's heartbeat suddenly pounds out of the speaker, stopping Jake in midsentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I've got him...Bring it in....

dialogues.speaker: 92-C
dialogues.text: Michael is turning the sub as quickly as he can, looking around frantically for the shark.  There's nothing to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: 92-D
dialogues.text: The heartbeats are coming stronger.  The line on the scop is fluctuating wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, get your ass up here...Now!

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE WATER
dialogues.text: 93 The sub moves toward the barge, making its way slowly -- the eye almost leisurely, even though it's going full out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming...How close is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close...I don't know...Just get the hell....

dialogues.speaker: 93-A
dialogues.text: Clarence suddenly goes rigid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From his point of view, seen through binoculars, the fin slices through the water.

dialogues.speaker: 93-B
dialogues.text: Michael pushes the sub to its limit, when suddenly it's h and Michael's teeth are rattled as the sub is knocked through the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) Jake!  Jake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shark hits the sub again, his great jaws tearing into canopy and prop, damaging the sub badly.  It turns then a almost leisurely swims away, its mouth bleeding, its head raked with cuts.  Michael eyes it, then the nearby wreck and pushes himself free of the sub, swimming as fast as h can toward the freighter.  The shark turns and starts aft him, closing the distance rapidly as Michael makes for an opening in the wreck's hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) Michael!  Can you hear me....

dialogues.speaker: NEPTUNE'S FOLLY
dialogues.text: 94 Jake is watching the scope.  The line indicates a heart that's gone crazy.  The heartbeat from the speaker is booming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right, Michael?  What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE WATER
dialogues.text: 95 Michael swims the last few feet to the wreck, moving thro a hole in its hull just as the shark is about to get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 96 Michael swims into a corridor which is filled with light coming from one end.  He turns and looks back at the hole The shark is gone.  He looks up and down the corridor, th starts swimming away from the light. The corridor begins to turn dark as a huge black shadow fills the other end. Michael senses something and looks back and sees the shad of the shark against the wall.  He freezes as the shadow moves toward him, finally covering his face. The shark comes closer and Michael starts backing up.  Th shark moves closer, almost lazily opening its jaws as it prepares to devour him.  Michael keeps backing up, then trips and falls backwards through a door, his arms coming up as he tries to stop himself. His fall takes him down into a room.  Light floods into i from above.  He gathers himself and looks up. There's no sign of the shark.  He looks about quickly, ta measure of his situation, then the light above is blacked as the shark swims slowly over the room.  Michael watches barely breathing, until the light returns.  He listens an looks and waits.  The silence builds.  Where the hell is

dialogues.speaker: 96-A
dialogues.text: thru        OMITTED thru 98 98

dialogues.speaker: THE BARGE
dialogues.text: 99 The submersible pops to the surface, its ballast tank destroyed by the shark.  Water pours from the space Micha occupied.  The heartbeats continue to be heard.  Jake, Clarence and William stare at the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the bang sticks.  We're going down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bang sticks are like yelling at it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going down.  All of us....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clarence starts moving quickly to the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he goes) They won't kill it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll divert it...We'll do something....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William is breaking out wet suits.  He throws one to Jake

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Screw the wet suits.  No time....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake gets out the air tanks and regulators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We'll do something...Michael's down there.  Get the lead out....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 Michael eyes the opening above him.  That, and the door h fell through, are the only way in or out.  His breathing has returned to normal.  He takes off his air tank, handl it with care. There's an explosion of wood and metal next to him and th shark bursts through the bulkhead.  Quickly Michael pulls the regulator, blows the air from the tank, and rides upward on the force of air coming from the bottle, just barely escaping the great jaws.  He shoots up through the opening above him, ripping his arm against the side of th opening as he passes through and the water starts to fill with blood.

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER/THE BARGE
dialogues.text: 101 Jake, Clarence and William have their air tanks strapped They each hold bang sticks and are getting ready to go in when Michael explodes up above the surface right in front them, gasping for air. Jake jumps in the water and grabs Michael and Clarence an William pull Michael aboard and Jake climbs up after him. Michael crawls away from the edge of the barge.  He's sha Jake moves to him.  Clarence and William gather around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael doesn't answer and Jake looks at him with concern

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 103 Michael sits bolt upright, as though he's been discharged from a gun.  He's sweating.  Carla sleeps peacefully next to him.  He gets himself under control and leaves the bed

dialogues.speaker: THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: 104 The light comes on and Michael looks at himself in the mirror, not sure he recognizes the image staring back at him   His arm is bandaged where he cut himself escaping from the shark.  He can hear his own heart beating.

dialogues.speaker: 104-A
dialogues.text: Michael is in the sub.  Jake, Clarence and William stand the side of the barge.  The sub is taped together and has no canopy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my turn in the barrel, man....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fall off a horse, you get right back on or you don't ride again....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask you to....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Carla's gig?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going down, Jake....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not going to like it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael puts his regulator in his mouth and starts slowly to move away and down beneath the surface.  Jake watches for a moment, an unhappy man, then moves quickly to the monitor and scope on the boat.  Clarence and William take up their stations with binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope the man knows what he's doing....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows what he has to do....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake's expression belies his words.  He's deeply concerne 105 105 thru        OMITTED thru 115 115

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE WATER
dialogues.text: 116 Michael has already spotted a group of conch.  He parks t sub and quickly gets to work tagging them.  He looks abou quickly as though something is coming up behind him. There's nothing there.  He finishes and returns to the su and maneuvers it up off the ground and continues his sear for more conch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You getting a reading on them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I live to hear the sound...You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the monitor...?  You getting anything on the shark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing...Hey Michael...You know I was thinking about yesterday.  Maybe all that was wrong was he was hungry....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come only me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he only likes white meat....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, Jake...Funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just trying to be helpful....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jake speaks, the head of a Moray eel explodes out of a rock crevice right in front of Michael and his heart near stops.

dialogues.speaker: THE PUBLIC BEACH
dialogues.text: 118 The beach and water are crowded with sunbathers and swimmers, with several banana boats and sailfish. Up from the beach, a short distance away, a crowd has gathered to witness the unveiling of Carla's statue.  The Mayor of the island, Mr. Witherspoon, a dignified black man, is in the midst of his dedication speech.  The statu looms behind him, shrouded beneath its cloth.  Carla, Ell Thea and Louisa, who totes a camera, along with several local "big-wigs" stand next to him. LOUISA                           WITHERSPOON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are they?        Something we look at ever day, something we think CARLA                beautiful...Something that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be here....                makes us stop and pond Something that makes us

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla searches the water for        question the wonder o a moment, then turns her        Even that becomes unique  attention back to the speech.        when it falls to the She's very unhappy about        artist's eye.... Michael's absence. Thea, who's bored stiff, eyes a group of friends getting ready to go out on a banana boat, a long "hotdog" which five riders straddle, holding onto grips in front of them THEA                                   WITHERSPOON (0.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tugging                            (continuing) at Carla)                        Art transforms the ordin Can I go on the banana boat?        into the unique...A s Margaret's going.  She's        for example.... with her mother. Carla sees what Thea's talking about, and she sees how bored she is. CARLA                           WITHERSPOON (0.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...Be careful....                    (continuing) We see a sunset in all its THEA                        glory, yet the artist sees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will....                        something that isn't th for the rest of us....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thea runs to join her friends, yelling at them to wait as she tears across the beach.  Ellen watches with concern. Carla sees it. CARLA                           WITHERSPOON (0.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banana boats are fun....            (continuing) Something from the inner LOUISA                eye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd go with her if I could....            (Pauses) Today we are privileged CARLA                to dedicate a work of art

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks....                        that reflects the true spirit, the free expression LOUISA                of life here in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are friends for...?        Bahamas.... Carla looks at Mr. Witherspoon cross-eyed and Louisa stifles a laugh and the two women exchange smiles.  Then Carla looks at Ellen, who manages a small smile, then tur her attention back to Thea, who's taking the last empty seat, one from the back, just in front of Margaret's moth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla Brody, a grand addition to our community, an artist of growing reputation, was commissioned to express our way of life in permanent form....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boat takes off behind its speedboat and the kids in i begin to shriek, Thea loudest of all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) So that whoever visits our public beach will be able to share in that spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen continues to watch Thea, Mr. Witherspoon signals to Carla and she moves forward to join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Ladies and gentlemen, Carla Brody....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Applause greets her introduction and she nods and smiles her thanks, then she and Mr. Witherspoon both take hold o the cord which will pull the cloth from the statue.  Loui begins to video tape the proceedings.  Someone gets in he way and she says something, then jostles for better posit Ellen eyes Thea as the banana boat makes a sweeping turn and heads back across the water in front of them. As Mr. Witherspoon and Carla pull the cord, Ellen sees th fin pop up out of the water behind the banana boat.  As t cloth comes free of the statue, the crowd breaks into lou anticipatory applause.  It covers Ellen's scream.  She starts running for the beach, yelling as she goes.   The moves closer to the boat.  The applause begins to trickle away as the crowd begins to realize the nature of the hug abstract work of art.  They don't understand it. Mr. Witherspoon looks at it quizzically. Ellen's screams are heard now and Carla sees her running along the beach, waving her arms.  Then she sees what Ell sees, the fin, and she and Louisa and the others start running.

dialogues.speaker: THE BANANA BOAT
dialogues.text: 119 Margaret's mother sees what's going on on the beach and finally looks in back of her and sees the fin and then th shark as it comes up out of the water for Thea.  She grabs the child, pushing her forward, putting herself in the way.  The shark rips into her and she's pulled into t water, then beneath it.  Thea screams, but nothing comes out.  Air starts leaking from the inflatable boat.  The water around it starts filling with blood. Ellen watches her granddaughter, horrified. Dozens of people line the water's edge around her, yellin crowding around as the speedboat brings what's left of the banana boat to shore.  Thea and the other two kids and remaining adult are holding on for dear life as they' dragged through the water. Carla, with Louisa at her heels, wades out toward them, frantic, yelling....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thea...I'm here, Thea...Mommy's here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen stares at the sea, then at her granddaughter, who Carla has reached.  When she sees that Thea is in one piece, unseen by anyone, she moves back through the crowd and starts away.  She walks deliberately, then begins to march.  Finally she breaks into a run and disappears from view.

dialogues.speaker: THE BIG BOAT/THE DOCK
dialogues.text: 121 As a hand fumbles with a key and finally gets it into the engine, the distant sound of singing is heard. The key is turned and the                MICHAEL AND JAKE engine cranks over a few             (singing) times, then starts,                'I found my thrill on drowning out the singing.        Blueberry Hill -- on Blueberry Hill -- when I found you.  The moon stood still on Blueberry Hill....'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen moves to the bow and casts off, throwing the lines the dock.  She does the same at the stern, then experimen with the clutch and the boat starts pulling away.

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER/THE BOAT
dialogues.text: 122 From another point of view, a point of land at the end of the beach where Michael and Jake live, the boat is seen heading out into the Atlantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 123 A dozen beer bottles are lined up on the rail of the porch.  Michael and Jake's feet are seen resting on the rail near them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) '...I found my thrill on Blueberry Hill....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like that song....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know the words....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're sitting side by side, both holding bottles of bee both half in the bag.  They both take long swallows at th same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; grinning; singing) A Moray eel...A Moray eel....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) 'It was so ugly...It was so big....'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) 'A Moray eel....'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) 'Snuck up on me....'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) 'It got us in hot water...We should have been there for Carla....'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mention of it, the memory of what caused him to miss the ceremony, his need to confront his fear, all make him suddenly unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be so down, man.  Money's gone...Shark's gone...We're back to conch...We've got it made....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shove it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be the eternal tropo...The old man and the sea...Know the words to this one? (singing; "Mack The Knife") 'Oh, the shark has pretty teeth, dear, and he shows them pearly white...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like my voice...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like the song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough shit. (singing) 'When the shark bites with his teeth, dear...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael stands and grabs Jake in a single motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake grabs Michael's shirt.  He's still sitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you, Jake....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael pulls away and starts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Screw you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake laughs as Michael storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) 'Oh, the shark has pretty teeth, dear....'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His grin fades as Michael disappears from view.  He takes swallow of beer, then mutters, "sorry..."   Alone he seem as unhappy as Michael.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOAT/THE WATER
dialogues.text: 124 The boat is well out into the ocean now   There's no land in sight.  Ellen is a tiny figure at the wheel.  She stan straight and tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 125 He completes the short walk from Jake's and enters his house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he enters) Carla?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 126 He moves inside, looking for people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla!  Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks in a room, then moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Thea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves toward his daughter's room.

dialogues.speaker: THEA'S ROOM
dialogues.text: 127 Michael looks in and comes up short.  He sees Carla on Thea's bed, rocking their daughter gently in her arms. Thea's eyes are wide open, her expression blank.  Louisa sits in a chair next to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hissing a whisper) Where have you been...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?  What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thea was attacked by a shark....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is stunned.  He can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor said she should be all right...She's in shock....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it went away...We would have known....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What went away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were doing research.  It disappeared. We thought....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It went away....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to the bed, to look at his daughter, who stares past him, as though he's not there.  It breaks his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; softly) Sweetheart....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) She could have been killed...You knew and you didn't tell us...You let your mother think....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you do that?  Your own daughter....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Why didn't you tell us? (breaking; enraged) Why didn't you tell us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back) I'm sorry.  Please, Carla.  I didn't think there was any danger.  I'm sorry. I love you.  Both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It suddenly strikes him.  He knows where his mother has gone.  He goes to the window.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCK
dialogues.text: 128 From the window, from Michael's point of view, he sees that the boat is gone.  He runs from the room, passing Louisa, who looks at him angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Jake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 129 He runs from the house and heads for the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling as he goes) Jake!  Jake!

dialogues.speaker: THE BIG BOAT
dialogues.text: 131 Ellen steers the boat at full throttle, out farther into the Atlantic, scanning the water for the shark, determina tion set deeply into her expression.

dialogues.speaker: THE POINT
dialogues.text: 132 Hoagie is setting up to fish from the point at the end of beach where Michael and Jake live.  He checks his bait an hook, then casts, then sees the dinghy heading toward him

dialogues.speaker: THE DINGHY/THE POINT
dialogues.text: 133 Jake rides in the bow.  Michael steers.  They see Hoagie, and Jake starts waving at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) You see our boat? HOAGIE                           MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)                            (yelling) I just got here....                My mother took it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) I hope she's a good sailor....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) A shark attacked Thea and some kids...She's going after it.... HOAGIE                           MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)                            (yelling) She's going after it...?        We've got to stop her.... Hoagie understands what's going on and starts reeling in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) You're going after her in that? You're crazy...It'll take all day in that bathtub....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) You got a better idea...?

dialogues.speaker: THE AIRPORT
dialogues.text: 134 A small, low-wing aircraft takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 135 Hoagie is already turning to head out over the water. Michael is straining to see the ocean.  They have to yell to be heard over the din of the engines.  Jake rides next to Hoagie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When we find her we'll radio her position...The Coast Guard will pick her up.  Don't worry....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be all right, partner.. She'll never find it.  We couldn't....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will find her....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake looks at him like he's crazy.  This is something he hasn't heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, it'll find her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said it was coming.... JAKE                                   MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, it's                What the hell are y coming...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has it in her head that the shark that killed Martin and Sean is.... JAKE                                   MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael)                    (to Hoagie) He's not talking about our        What do you do when you shark....                        not flying people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I deliver laundry...We're going to circle northeast....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoagie changes directions.... JAKE                                   MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saying she thinks the        Everything's a joke to shark is after her...?                you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Ellen....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't need a drug dealer for....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoagie starts laughing.  Jake is looking at them both wit disbelief. MICHAEL                           JAKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's so funny...?        That's a lot of crap. Sharks don't....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to find her as much as you do, Michael....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to leave her alone.  I don't want you involving her in....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spotting something) What's that....?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points and they see a tiny dot of a boat in the distance.  Hoagie starts for it and they watch as he drop altitude.  There's a long silence as they strain to see t boat.  When they get closer they see that it's a pleasure sailor.  The people aboard wave at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not ready to give it up) What do you deliver on all those charters you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fly elephants for smugglers....

dialogues.speaker: THE BOAT
dialogues.text: 136 Ellen searches the water for the shark.  She puts the boa into a long slow turn.  All she can see is the endless expanse of ocean around her.

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER
dialogues.text: 137 The boat is seen from the surface, from the point of view of something following her, keeping pace with her. The shark is stalking her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 138 Hoagie, Michael and Jake fly on in search of Ellen. Michael is raw nerve ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't this thing go any faster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any faster and it'll turn into a flying Cuisinart and dice us into oblivion....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoagie banks the plane, changing direction to search another area.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOAT/THE WATER
dialogues.text: 139 Ellen turns the wheel, beginning another sweep, searching for the shark.  At first she doesn't see anything, then s goes rigid. A hundred yards away she sees the fin. She shuts off the engine and, in the quiet, moves to the stern and looks at the shark, which is keeping its distan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly; with deadly calm) Come and get me, you son-of-a-bitch. Take me and leave my family alone....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silence builds as only the water lapping up against t side of the becalmed boat is heard. The fin disappears beneath the surface and Ellen, still a the stern, her body trembling, looks for it.  She can't see anything.  The silence builds.  She waits. Then, in the intense calm, the distant sound of an airpla engine droning is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 140 Jake sees the boat and points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see the boat and the tiny figure of Ellen at the ste Hoagie alters course, dropping altitude as he goes.  He starts fishing for a chart so he can radio her exact loca tion.  Michael rises in his seat to get a better view.  H sees something in the water and strains to make out what it is.

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER
dialogues.text: 141 The dark form of the shark is visible beneath the surface as it moves rapidly toward the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 142 They strain to see the form in the water as the plane mov rapidly closer to the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what I think it is...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer is necessary as they watch the shark close the distance to the boat.  It's going for Ellen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Christ....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper) Mom....

dialogues.speaker: THE BOAT
