dialogues.text: 143 The shark comes exploding up out of the water for Ellen, missing her by only a few feet, taking a piece of the ste off the boat, then disappearing beneath the surface. Then she hears the plane and looks but doesn't seem to se it.  She's in shock from the shark's attack, but is still dedicated to her mission. The plane flies in low, buzzing the boat, the great roar of its engine causing Ellen to duck out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 144 Hoagie makes a tight circle and starts back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow it down....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to open a door.  Jake stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to get to her....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You jump, you'll kill yourself....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you worried about...?  You make it, the shark will kill you anyway...I'm going in....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoagie grabs his microphone and switches it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; on the horn) Thomas, my boy, you there?  This is PBN 17452....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing; from the speaker) Boss is going to be pissed at you for taking his plane, Hoagie....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) Wait till he finds out what I'm going to do with it....

dialogues.speaker: THE BOAT
dialogues.text: 145 Ellen watches the plane with horror as it comes in on a line parallel to the boat, coming closer and closer to th water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still on the horn) A couple of boats, fast, and someone who knows how to kill a shark.  A big one....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the microphone back and starts preparing to bring the plane into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Grab your socks....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you know how to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, no.  What kind of pilot do you think I am...?

dialogues.speaker: THE BOAT/THE PLANE/THE WATER
dialogues.text: 147 Ellen backs away from the stern as the plane nears the surface and its engine sputters, then quits.  It hits the water and its nose rocks forward, then it settles forward and skips some seventy-five feet, plowing through the wat violently, finally coming to a stop near the boat. Hoagie pushes the door open and water starts coming in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, that wasn't half bad.. Get going...I'll keep it busy....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll come for the plane.  It's attracted to metal.  The electro- magnetic impulse....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you get the bloody hell out of here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake jumps into the water and starts swimming for the boa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Hoagie....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you passengers are the same.... Complain...Complain....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes Michael out.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOAT/THE PLANE
dialogues.text: 149 Ellen sees Jake, then Michael swimming frantically for th boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Michael!  No, goddamnit!  No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she sees the shark heading for the plane and Hoagie and she stares at it and the image of Hoagie, who backs u the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; barely audible) Hoagie...No....

dialogues.speaker: THE PLANE
dialogues.text: 150 The shark attacks the plane, going straight for the cockp rising up out of the water, blocking Hoagie from view, taking a mouthful of door, then rolling off and disappear beneath the surface.  Hoagie is gone. Michael and Jake scramble aboard.  They move quickly to Ellen and Michael puts his arm around her, trying to offe comfort.  She's in shock.  They stare at the plane as it starts to sink, scanning the water, looking for Hoagie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) It got him....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry; passionately) Why'd you come out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you take the boat? ELLEN                           MICHAEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you bring them...?            (his voice Didn't you realize what you were doing...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It kept coming...There was        You shouldn't have done no other way to stop it....        it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to.  It was all I could do....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly her anger explodes.  Michael tries to hold her b she pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I tried to tell you...I tried....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling from the other side) Give me a hand here for Christ's sake....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn and see Hoagie struggling to climb aboard and move quickly to help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; grinning) That thing has terrible breath....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull him aboard and he smiles at Ellen, who is very happy indeed to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What say we get the hell out of here, Ellen Brody. ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her started....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoagie and Michael start for the engine.  Ellen watches them, then looks out over the water for the shark.  Jake turns on the heart monitor and EKG scope and a moment lat the sound of the shark's heartbeat, which is faint, start coming through the speaker, and the sight of its rhythmic beating is seen on the scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's working....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoagie watches as Michael tries to get the engine started It won't turn over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the engine, pal....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake heads for the cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he goes) Get it going, Hoagie.  Michael....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael follows Jake below.  Hoagie jumps down into the engine pit and starts checking the fuel line. Ellen stares out to sea, waiting for what she knows will happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the plane gave it indigestion....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from below; yelling) They spend half their lives looking for food and the other half eating it   They don't care what it is....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) It's not food it's after....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The distant sounds of the shark's heart continue to be he

dialogues.speaker: BELOW DECKS
dialogues.text: 152 Jake takes the top off an underwater strobe light and begins rewiring rapidly, changing connections.  Michael watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in the midst of it) If it works, if we can get it inside the bastard and set it off, it'll shock the hell out of it.  We'll need a slave switch to set it off. Pull the dry cell out of the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody ever tell you you're nuts....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael starts pulling the battery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) All the time....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll work....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theory, partner...If it responds to external electrical impulse, it might respond to one coming from inside it...Confuse it...Drive it away....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're real lucky, it'll eat itself....

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE DECKS
dialogues.text: 153 Hoagie hands Ellen sparkplugs, which she dries with a rag She continues to glance at the sea, her expression set wi the inevitable.  The shark's faint heartbeats are heard.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW DECKS
dialogues.text: 154 Jake is taping a cover over the strobe base.  Michael is wiring another strobe light to the battery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait for the sucker to charge, then hit the switch.  Just like taking a picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big picture...If we can't get him to swallow it, we'll shove it up his....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) I forgot my rubber gloves.  Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head for the deck

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE DECKS
dialogues.text: 155 As Michael and Jake move topside, they see Hoagie and Ell staring at the speaker and EKG scope.  The heartbeats hav stopped.  The line on the scope is flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your equipment has crapped out again....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My equipment doesn't crap out....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake grabs a pole from the deck and throws it to Michael, then starts tying the device to the end of it.  His hands are trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it had a heart attack.  Too much fatty food.  Humans are full of cholesterol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoagie gets the last sparkplug screwed back in and tries the engine and it kicks to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Son-of-a-bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake starts for the bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael) Get a line....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael grabs a coiled line from the deck and follows Jak forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ellen) We're going to make it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just stares at him, not believing it for a moment. Jake is standing at the bow, looking out over the water. Michael reaches him with the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it, Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my fault...I have to....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need it to eat electronics, man ...Not you.  Get it on me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a plea) Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning) I'm the one who wanted to study it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael relents and quickly ties the line around Jake's waist.  Jake makes his way out to the end of the bowsprit using the guy wire from the mast for support.  Michael passes him the pole with the device at the end of it. Ellen and Hoagie watch from the stern.  He's underway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; yelling back) Keep it steady....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, aye, Captain....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shark explodes up completely out of the water, cleari the surface, opening its jaws as it comes directly for Michael, who leaps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake moves back on the bowsprit, getting in the shark's way, and as the shark flies up toward Jake, he rams the pole down its throat.  The pole snaps and the shark takes the device, Jake and a piece of the bowsprit. Ellen screams. The guy wire flies loose and the already weakened mast begins to fall. Michael pulls at the line, which goes limp in his hands. Jake, in the shark's mouth, goes crashing into the water. The mast crashes into the boat and water. Ellen and Hoagie are running forward. Michael watches as Jake and the shark disappear beneath t surface. In the distance, the three of them see the shark rise up out of the water.  Part of Jake is seen in its jaws.  The they're gone. The heartbeats are heard again. Michael opens his mouth and a great wail of anguish comes out and carries out over the water. Hoagie dashes back toward the controls.  Ellen, taking strength from her son's need, grabs his arm, hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) Get that goddamn gizmo of Jake's working....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael stares at the sea.  Ellen looks at her son compassionately, then Michael starts for the cabin and Ellen follows to the deck near Hoagie, where she watches the water. The shark's heartbeats are getting louder and closer together.  Hoagie eyes the speaker as he opens the thrott giving it everything its got.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW DECKS
dialogues.text: 156 Michael grabs the slave switch and turns it on and it begins to whine as the strobe unit in the shark's stomach begins to charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) It's coming....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the switch too soon.   Nothing happens.  He can h the heartbeats thumping a frenzy as the shark begins its attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing!  What the hell are you doing down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whine begins to build again.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE DECKS
dialogues.text: 157 The heartbeats sound like an invitation to hell.  Hoagie grabs Ellen's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the wheel....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leaves it before she does and runs to the cabin.  She takes his place, glancing at the water, seeing the fin. Her expression floods with rage and she turns the wheel toward the shark, trying to meet it head on.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW DECKS
dialogues.text: 158 Hoagie sticks his head in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The damn thing is going to have our asses....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It needs more time to charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start topside.  Michael brings the slave switch with him.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE DECKS/THE WATER
dialogues.text: 159 Ellen is bringing the boat directly toward the shark, whi is coming straight for them.  The heartbeats are deafenin As Hoagie and Michael move topside, the boat and the shar collide head on, sending shock waves from stem to stern. Ellen holds onto the wheel with both hands and keeps her feet.  Michael and Hoagie are knocked on their asses. The heartbeats retreat, then start growing louder and stronger again.  The whine of the strobe has stopped. Michael hits the switch several times and it starts again Ellen sees the fin and steers toward it.  The shark is coming again, like an old boxer looking for the knockout punch in the fifteenth round. The boat and the shark are heading for each other, the distance between them closing fast. Ellen drives the boat toward it. The slave switch makes a popping sound, and Michael hits switch and the flash in his hand goes off. The water explodes as the shark receives an enormous jolt of electricity.  It thrashes about wildly then, in slow motion, some twenty-five feet from the boat, right in fro of it, the shark rises up out of the water, exposing half its body.  It seems suspended there, its great head point right at Ellen, its dead black eyes seeming to stare straight at her. Holding fast to the wheel, her expression set hard, Ellen drives the boat straight at the shark.  She pushes the throttle forward, hard, getting the last bit of speed fro the engine, driving straight into the beast, impaling it the throat with what's left of the sharp jagged end of th bowsprit. The shark goes crazy, its weight pulling the bow down int the water as it tries to free itself, thrashing about so violently that it turns the bow into splinters. Ellen, Michael and Hoagie are thrown into the water.

dialogues.speaker: THE WATER
dialogues.text: 160 They watch as the shark dies its violent death, taking wh remains of the boat beneath the surface with it.

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: 161 The shark and the boat sink slowly to the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: THE SURFACE
dialogues.text: 162 Ellen, exhausted, emptied of everything, begins to sob. Everything she feels, everything she's suppressed about Sean's death pours out of her.  She begins to slip beneat the surface.  Hoagie grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you can....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael reaches them and together, helping Ellen, they sw to a large piece of the boat which is floating nearby. Holding it, catching their breath, Ellen still crying, th look out across the water, silently remembering Jake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) It's over....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen stares at the sea, her expression etched with uncertainty.  Is it over?  Will it ever be? Our vision shifts from Ellen to her point of view of the endless expanse of ocean.  In the distance the clouds see to be reaching for its surface.  Slowly, almost indiscernibly at first, the closing music begins.  Anothe sound, that of airplane engines is heard.

dialogues.speaker: THE AIRPORT
dialogues.text: 164 The noise of the air taxi's engines, as they're warmed up is loud.  The music, which builds slowly, relentlessly, continues.  Closing credits begin, like punctuation marks Hoagie is in the cockpit. Ellen, who's dressed for travel, Michael, who carries The and Carla approach the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling to be heard above the noise) I want you all to come to Amity this summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a lot...I want to talk about it....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's having trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will...We'll have a lot of time together. (pauses) What are you going to do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) We'll be there....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Thea) You make sure they come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling; liking the excitement) I will.  I'll miss you, Grandma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) I'll miss you....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've reached the plane and Hoagie and Ellen make eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing his mother and Hoagie) Promise me you'll be all right....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to him; yelling) Promise me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) I'll wear my rubbers...I'll be careful ...I'll be....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling; grinning) Mothers and sons...Mine used to tell me to wear clean shorts....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (both yelling; both enjoying the moment) In case you got hit by a car....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh above the noise.  Michael and Hoagie eye each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling at Hoagie) You know, you try harder not to give a damn than anyone I've ever met?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoagie, straining to hear, grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael moves closer, Thea still in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (before Michael can repeat himself; yelling). Can I fly the plane again...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music dips now, as Hoagie takes a long 1ook at Thea, his smile building warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely...Any time....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He beckons her with his finger and Michael holds her clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Can you keep a secret?  Something no one else knows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still yelling at the top of her lungs) Yes I can....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling back) I own the airplane.  I can do whatever I want.  I'm the boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, Ellen and Carla react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Which means I have to go a lot of places to pay my debts and borrow money to keep it going....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Michael with mischief in his eye.  The music begins to build again, toward its climax.  Credits contin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; yelling louder) Remind me when I get back to tell you about the time I flew a hundred nuns to Nairobi....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and others laugh, but it's lost in the sound of t engines and the music.  The family moves to the plane's door.  Ellen kisses Carla and Thea good-bye, then turns t Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (above the noise) We never had that talk, did we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her, troubled, and she smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We will...We'll have a lot of time together, Michael....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) I'm going to finish what Jake and I started.  I owe him that.  Hell, I owe him everything.... (shouting; hardly heard) I'll get something important done for both of us....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen and Michael embrace, then kiss each other good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling) There they were, all hundred of them....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His last words are drowned out by engines and music and h shrugs as he and Ellen smile at each other.  She takes a last look at her family, then boards the plane and the do closes behind her.

dialogues.speaker: THE AIRPORT/THE PLANE
dialogues.text: 165 As music and credits continue, the plane takes off and starts out over the ocean, heading for Nassau. Michael, holding Thea, and Carla, her arm through his, watch as the plane becomes smaller and smaller, until it lost in the vastness of the sky and the sky is transforme into ocean and music and credits end.
